CatDescriptText: Marvin Jordan, 2166 Elmore Square, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 22, 1958, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that there will be an economic depression in near future like the one in the early thirties?" answer reads: "I don't think that it will be as severe as the economic depression of the '30s. But we are in one now.  It won't be as severe as the other one because of such things as unemployment compensation which helps persons who are unemployed.  But as I said, things now are in a critical state."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Marvin Jordan wearing dark hat, moustache, striped shirt, and zippered coat, standing in front of marble pillar in corridor with people and store windows on either side
